metadata.title: Complete SwiftUI Integration: Finishing the Entire UI

inlineContent.text: Maximize the synergy between SwiftData and SwiftUI.
Complete the entire TaskMaster app UI including
lists, detail views, edit sheets, and swipe actions.

sections.title: Complete SwiftUI Integration: Finishing the Entire UI

inlineContent.text: Basic structure combining NavigationStack and List.
Place an add button in the toolbar.
Divide sections by complete/incomplete or by category.
Display a guidance message when there are no tasks.
Complete the main list view displaying tasks.
Consider section grouping, empty states, and loading states.
Design the Row view displaying each list item.
Include priority indicator, due date, category badge, etc.
Display title, completion checkbox, and priority indicator.
Show due date if available, highlight if imminent.
Add a mode for direct editing in the detail view.
Implement navigation from list to detail view.
Create a view showing detailed information of the selected task.
Implement a sheet UI for modifying tasks.
Include save/cancel buttons and input validation.
A sheet for adding new tasks.
Include required input validation and category selection.
A sheet for modifying existing tasks.
Apply a pattern for rolling back changes on cancel.
Set destructive delete that executes immediately without confirmation.
Add a context menu appearing on long press.
Add swipe actions familiar to iOS users.
Perform completion toggle, delete, edit via swipe.
Assemble all components created so far
Configure list and settings screens with TabView.
Setting role: .destructive displays it in red,
and full swipe executes without confirmation.
Set Button’s role to .destructive in swipeActions
User still needs to swipe intentionally.
To delete immediately without confirmation on swipe delete in SwiftUI?
What SwiftUI component displays empty list state?
is suitable for displaying empty state, no search results, etc.
Advantage of binding SwiftData objects with @Bindable?
are automatically saved by SwiftData’s autosave.
Cancellation is not automatic. Implement manually if needed.
Network sync requires separate CloudKit setup.

sections.title: Schema Migration: Safe Data Model Changes

abstract.text: When an app updates, data models change too.
Safely migrate user data with VersionedSchema and SchemaMigrationPlan.
Master the four fundamental data operations completely.
Learn intuitive modification patterns using ModelContext’s
insert, delete, and @Bindable.
ModelContainer is where data is stored,
and ModelContext is the workspace for manipulating data.

doc://swiftdata.HIGSwiftData/tutorials/H.title: Complete SwiftUI Integration: Finishing the Entire UI

abstract.text: Maximize the synergy between SwiftData and SwiftUI.
Complete the entire TaskMaster app UI including
lists, detail views, edit sheets, and swipe actions.
Use the same task list on iPhone, iPad, and Mac
with iCloud integration.
Surprisingly, only a few lines of configuration are needed.
Master the four fundamental data operations completely.
Learn intuitive modification patterns using ModelContext’s
insert, delete, and @Bindable.
Create type-safe filters with the #Predicate macro,
and implement various sorting with SortDescriptor.
Complete user-customized views by connecting with dynamic UI.
Use the same task list on iPhone, iPad, and Mac
with iCloud integration.
Surprisingly, only a few lines of configuration are needed.

abstract.text: Real app data is interconnected.
Set up relationships between models with the @Relationship macro,
and ensure data integrity with delete rules.

doc://swiftdata.HIGSwiftData/tutorials/H.title: Introduction to SwiftData: The Game Changer

abstract.text: SwiftData, unveiled by Apple at WWDC23, is a next-generation
data persistence framework that completely replaces Core Data.
When an app updates, data models change too.
Safely migrate user data with VersionedSchema and SchemaMigrationPlan.
When an app updates, data models change too.

ModelContainer is where data is stored,
and ModelContext is the workspace for manipulating data.
The @Model macro is the heart of SwiftData.
It transforms pure Swift classes into persistable data models.

doc://swiftdata.HIGSwiftData/tutorials/T.title: TaskMaster: Building a Task Management App with SwiftData

abstract.text: Forget the complexity of Core Data. SwiftData is a next-generation
data persistence framework designed entirely for Swift developers.
ModelContainer is where data is stored,
and ModelContext is the workspace for manipulating data.
Maximize the synergy between SwiftData and SwiftUI.
Complete the entire TaskMaster app UI including
lists, detail views, edit sheets, and swipe actions.

Safely migrate user data with VersionedSchema and SchemaMigrationPlan.
